page.title: 13Fordell Railway
page.content: The{Fordell Railway}ran between{St. {David's harbour}and{Fordell mines. It was used for the purpose of carrying coal from the pits at Fordell to St.Davids harbour.In{1833}the wooden rails were replaced by iron rails and a tunnel was built under the main road, now the{A92.}In{1867} steel rails replaced the iron ones and the introduction of steam engines proved benificial. The Fordell Railway was different from other railways in the way that it had a{4'4"}gauge, and this was continued right up until it was closed in{1946.}In{April 1896 there was a fatal accident, when one of the locomotives blew up killing two men. On the railway there were a number of branch lines, one even leading up to the rear of{Fordell {House.
